content.question: A water tank is in the shape of a right circular cone as shown above. The diameter of the cone is 10 feet, and the height is 15 feet. The shape of the water in the tank is conical with radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet and height <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet. At noon, water is leaking from the bottom of the tank at a rate of 12 cubic feet per hour, and the volume of water in the tank is <math alttext="27 pi " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic feet. At noon, what is the rate at which the height of the water in the tank is changing? (The volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a right circular cone with radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and height <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="V equals, one third pi, times r squared, times h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.)

choices.label: Decreasing at <math alttext="the fraction 4 over 9 pi, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per hour

Increasing at <math alttext="the fraction 4 over 9 pi, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per hour

Increasing at <math alttext="the fraction 4 over 3 pi, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per hour

Decreasing at <math alttext="the fraction 4 over 3 pi, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per hour
